abstract: Yahoo isn’t a stranger to the complex deal structure known as a “cash-rich split-off” that could be used to sell off its stakes in its Japanese affiliate and Alibaba Group.
snippet: Yahoo isn’t a stranger to the complex deal structure known as a “cash-rich split-off” that could be used to sell off its stakes in its Japanese affiliate and Alibaba Group.
lead_paragraph: The activist hedge fund Starboard Value fretted on Thursday that Yahoo might employ a type of complicated transaction to dispose its minority stakes in the Chinese Internet giant Alibaba Group and in the publicly traded Yahoo Japan.

headline.main: More on the Complex Tax-Minded Deal That Starboard Doesn’t Want Yahoo to Do

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
